intro: Pedicularis brachystachys, commonly known as the short-stalked lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family. This species is characterized by its bilaterally symmetrical flowers, which typically feature a spurred petal and a hooded structure. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it partially relies on its host plants for nutrients, and it often grows in nutrient-poor, rocky soils. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
